  • Method Details

    • setBase

      void setBase(String iriString) throws IRIParseException, IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the base absolute IRI for this manager using the provided IRI string.

      Parses the input string into an IRIRef, resolves it against the current base IRI, and normalizes it according to the manager's configured behavior. The resulting IRI must be absolute, as required by RFC 3986, Section 5.1 — Establishing a Base URI.

      Parameters:
      iriString - the string representation of the new base IRI
      Throws:
      IRIParseException - if the input is not a valid IRIRef
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resulting IRIRef is not absolute
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        #createIRIRef(String)
      • IRIRef.isAbsolute()

    • setBase

      void setBase(fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs.managers.AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI prefixedIRI) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the base absolute IRI using a AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI composed of a prefix and an IRIRef.

      This method resolves the iri part of the prefixedIRI against the IRI previously associated with the provided prefix, then normalizes the result. The resolved IRI is then stored as the new base IRI. The resulting IRI must be absolute, as required by RFC 3986, Section 5.1 — Establishing a Base URI.

      Parameters:
      prefixedIRI - a AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI containing the prefix and IRIRef to resolve
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resulting IRI is not absolute
      See Also:
      • createIRI(PrefixedIRI)

      • Note: If you construct the PrefixedIRI from strings, be aware that IRIParseException or NoSuchElementException may be thrown during its construction, not by this method.

    • getBase

      String getBase()
      Returns the string representation of the current base IRI.

      The base is always stored as an absolute, normalized IRI.

      Returns:
      the recomposed base IRI as a string

    • setPrefixed

      void setPrefixed(String key, String iriString) throws IRIParseException, IllegalArgumentException
      Associates a prefix with an absolute IRI, using the provided IRI string.

      The input string is parsed into an IRIRef, resolved against the current base IRI, and normalized according to the manager’s configured behavior. The resulting IRI must be absolute, as required by RFC 3987, Section 5.1 — Establishing a Base IRI.

      Prefix keys may be empty or contain whitespace, though it is discouraged for clarity. Null keys are forbidden and will trigger an exception.

      Parameters:
      key - the prefix identifier to associate (e.g., "ex", "rdf", or "")
      iriString - the string to parse into an absolute IRIRef associated with the prefix
      Throws:
      IRIParseException - if the input string is not a valid IRIRef
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resulting IRI is not absolute, or if the prefix is null
      See Also:
      • setBase(String)
      • createIRI(String)
      • IRIRef.isAbsolute()

    • setPrefixed

      void setPrefixed(String key, fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs.managers.AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI prefixedIRI) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Associates a prefix with an absolute IRI using a structured AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI input.

      The prefixedIRI object holds a prefix (already declared in the environment) and a relative IRIRef. This method resolves that IRIRef against the IRI associated with the prefix, normalizes the result, and stores the resulting absolute IRIRef under the given key.

      The prefix key may be empty or contain whitespace (though discouraged), but must not be null.

      Parameters:
      key - the prefix label to associate
      prefixedIRI - a AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI containing the base prefix and the relative IRIRef
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resulting IRI is not absolute, or the prefix key is null
      See Also:
      • createIRI(PrefixedIRI)
      • IRIRef.resolve(IRIRef)
      • IRIRef.isAbsolute()

    • getAllPrefixes

      Set<String> getAllPrefixes()
      Returns the set of all prefix labels currently registered in the environment.

      These are the keys used in setPrefixed(...) to associate IRIs, and may be used later to resolve prefixed IRIs or introspect the environment state.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable Set of all prefix keys currently stored in this manager
      See Also:
      • setPrefixed(String, String)
      • getPrefixed(String)

    • getPrefixed

      String getPrefixed(String key) throws NoSuchElementException
      Retrieves the absolute IRI string associated with the given prefix.

      The prefix must have previously been declared using setPrefixed(String, String) or a related method. The returned IRI is guaranteed to be normalized and absolute, following the manager's internal policy.

      Parameters:
      key - the prefix label to look up
      Returns:
      the normalized, absolute IRI string associated with the prefix
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the prefix has not been declared
      See Also:
      • getAllPrefixes()
      • setPrefixed(String, String)

    • createIRI

      String createIRI(String value) throws IRIParseException
      Creates a normalized full IRI from the given IRI string.

      The input string is parsed into an IRIRef, resolved against the current base IRI as defined in RFC 3986, Section 5.1 — Establishing a Base URI, and normalized according to the manager’s configured behavior. The resulting IRI is returned in its recomposed string form.

      Parameters:
      iriString - the string representation of a relative or full IRI
      Returns:
      the normalized, resolved full IRI as a string
      Throws:
      IRIParseException - if the input string is not a valid IRIRef
      See Also:
      • setBase(String)
      • IRIRef.resolve(IRIRef)
      • IRIRef.normalize()

    • createIRI

      String createIRI(fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs.managers.AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI prefixedIRI) throws IRIParseException, NoSuchElementException
      Creates a normalized full IRI from a AbstractIRIManager.PrefixedIRI.

      The IRI part of the input is resolved against the full IRI associated with the provided prefix, and normalized according to the manager's configuration.

      Parameters:
      prefixedIRI - a pair of (prefix, IRIRef) where the IRIRef is relative to the prefix
      Returns:
      the string representation of the resolved, normalized IRI
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the prefix is not associated with any IRI
      IRIParseException
      See Also:
      • setPrefixed(String, String)
      • IRIRef.resolve(IRIRef)
